text: Kirkus is an English surname originating from a family living near the kirkus, which referred to a 'kirk (church) house' or the 'parsonage'. The surname first was first found in Yorkshire, but is today most prevalent in the United States.https://www.houseofnames.com/kirkus- historyhttps://forebears.io/surnames/kirkus Notable people with this surname include: * Virginia Kirkus (1893–1980), founder of American book review magazine Kirkus Reviews * Colin Kirkus (1910–1942), British mountain climber and author * Sister Gregory Kirkus (1910–2007), English Roman Catholic nun, educator, historian and archivist. == References == == Further reading == * Category:Surnames
title: Kirkus (surname)
